intro: Bassovia novofriburgensis, commonly known as the Fribourg bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Switzerland. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are erect and often branched. Bassovia novofriburgensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
